sub_topic: Determining the solubility of a substance in a solvent
message_1: What is the maximum amount of sodium chloride that can be dissolved in 100 grams of water at room temperature?
message_2: The solubility of sodium chloride (NaCl) in water at room temperature (approximately 20°C or 68°F) is about 36 grams per 100 grams of water. This means that a maximum of 36 grams of sodium chloride can be dissolved in 100 grams of water at room temperature.
